Welcome to the 14th South West Cheshire Scout Group

Welcome to the website of the 14th Weston & Wychwood Scout Group. Here you will find information about what goes on at the 14th and how to get involved.

After many years absence of Scouting in the Cheshire village of Weston, near Crewe, Scouts returned on Monday 13th January 2014. Since then we have continued to increase our numbers of young people year on year for the last 3 years, as well as increasing our Leader numbers.

Our thriving and popular Group, meet at the Village Hall in Weston on Monday evenings in term time.

We currently have about Tewnthy  young people aged 6 – 10 years old from Weston and village, Wychwood Park and nearby villages who make up the 14th. We currently have two active sections; Beavers for 6 to 8 year olds, Cubs for 8 to 10½ year olds and NEW FOR 2017! Scout Section.

Each section meets each week to play some games, carry out activities and work towards one of the many badges available. There are also opportunities to go out on trips and camps throughout the year.

If you’d like your son or daughter to join any of the sections, please fill in their details here. Alternatively, you would like to get involved with running any of the sections, please get in touch, or check out the Adult Volunteering page for more informtion an extra pair of hands are always very welcome.
